description: From an- +‎ echoic, from echo +‎ -ic, from Middle English ecco, ekko, from Medieval Latin ecco, from Latin echo, from Ancient Greek ἠχώ (ēkhṓ), from ἠχή (ēkhḗ, “sound”).

adjectives.description: anechoic (comparative more anechoic, superlative most anechoic)

examples: The bassoonist settled into the anechoic chamber and prepared for another grueling recording session.
